Question
========

Which of the following situations shows two independent stochastic variables?

Answerlist
----------

* X is the number of solar hours yesterday at location A and Y is the number of solar hours at location B; both locations are right next to each other.
* X is the number of solar hours in Nijmegen this year and Y is the number of solar hours 50 years ago in Nijmegen.
* X is the rainfall in centimeters today in Amsterdam and Y is the rainfall in centimeters tomorrow in Amsterdam.
* X is the rainfall in centimeters today in The Hague and Y is the rainfall in centimeters today in the schilderswijk.

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* X is the number of solar hours yesterday at location A and Y is the number of solar hours at location B; both locations are right next to each other.:Incorrect
* X is the number of solar hours in Nijmegen this year and Y is the number of solar hours 50 years ago in Nijmegen.: Correct
* X is the rainfall in centimeters today in Amsterdam and Y is the rainfall in centimeters tomorrow in Amsterdam: Incorrect
* X is the rainfall in centimeters today in The Hague and Y is the rainfall in centimeters today in the schilderswijk...: Incorrect
